page.title: 09Crafts in Pevensey
page.content: Sam Fanaroff has lived and worked in Westham for 16 years.He belongs to the {Guild of Sussex Craftsmen. }He works in bronze and copper. In 1974 he made Westham village sign. It took six days to make. It is made of English Oak and copper.He does most of his work for churches,making bowls, crosses and candlesticks.The biggest thing he ever made was a six-foot cross.No-one else in his family is a craftsperson.They are all farmers. Mr.and Mrs Dent have lived in Westham 25 years.They run a {craft shop}near the castle. It is at least 309 years old.They live in the cottage attached.They sell local crafts,small gifts and souvenirs of Pevensey Castle.Mrs.Dent makes soft toys to sell and her husband does {wrought_iron work.}Most of their customers come on holiday from all over the world.
